intro: Potentilla verna, commonly known as spring cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, usually from April to June. Its leaves are palmately divided into five oval-shaped lobes, and it has a fibrous root system. Potentilla verna thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and rocky areas.
